name: Better Health Market
description: Better Health Store of Dearborn offers a wide variety of herbal, organic, and holistic health products, emphasizing healthy living and sustainability efforts in the community.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 9 AM - 8 PM; Sunday: 11 AM - 6 PM

name: Dearborn Farmers Market
description: The Dearborn Farmers Market focuses on sustainability by offering fresh, locally-produced food options, promoting community health and supporting local farmers.
hours_of_operation: June-September: Saturdays 8 AM - 1 PM; October-May: Thursdays 9 AM - 1 PM, Fridays 3 PM - 7 PM

name: Papaya Fruit Market
description: Papaya Fruit Market promotes sustainability through its focus on fresh, local produce and supports eco-friendly farming practices.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Sunday: 8 AM - 10 PM

name: ALDI
description: Offers organic produce, meats, and sustainable seafood, with a focus on eco-friendly practices. ALDI is committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and increasing packaging recyclability.
address: 24130 Van Born Rd, Dearborn Heights, MI 48125
hours_of_operation: Monday-Sunday: 9 AM - 8 PM

name: Detroit People’s Food Co-Op
description: A community-owned grocery cooperative offering locally sourced food, promoting food education, and fostering sustainable practices.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Sunday: 8 AM - 10 PM

name: Eastern Market
description: One of the nation's oldest and largest public markets, offering fresh produce, meats, and other goods. Supports local farmers and sustainable freight initiatives.
hours_of_operation: Saturday: 6 AM - 4 PM; Sunday: June-October: 10 AM - 4 PM; Tuesday: June-October: 9 AM - 3 PM

name: Nature's Compliments
description: A holistic shop offering zero-waste skincare with herbal and oil infusions. Based in Detroit but newly opened in February 2024.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Friday: 12 PM - 7 PM; Saturday: 10 AM - 5 PM

name: STEP Thrift Store & Donation Center
description: Thrift store that contributes to reducing waste and promoting reuse.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 10 AM - 7 PM; Sunday: 12 PM - 5 PM

name: Goodwill Dearborn Store
description: Sells secondhand goods and promotes sustainable practices such as recycling used items through donation.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 10 AM - 8 PM; Sunday: 12 PM - 6 PM

name: Motown Thrift Store
description: Family-owned thrift shop focusing on reducing waste and offering affordable goods.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 9 AM - 8 PM; Sunday: 10 AM - 8 PM

name: Plato's Closet
description: Plato’s Closet buys and sells gently used clothes, shoes, and accessories, promoting recycling.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 10 AM - 9 PM; Sunday: 11 AM - 6 PM

name: Value World
description: A thrift store offering a variety of used clothing, accessories, and household goods.
hours_of_operation: Monday-Sunday: 10 AM - 8 PM

name: Eugenie Detroit
description: A boutique specializing in sustainable, organic, and environmentally-friendly clothing.
hours_of_operation: Tuesday-Friday: 11 AM - 6 PM; Saturday-Sunday: 10 AM - 6 PM

name: Peace Park
description: The first of three state-of-the-art community parks in Dearborn with advanced water management systems.
hours_of_operation: n/a

name: Rouge River Gateway Trail
description: Scenic 2-mile bike path through densely forested woodland and nearby attractions.
hours_of_operation: n/a

name: Hines Park Trail
description: 20-mile trail connecting Michigan Ave. to Northville, offering parks and scenic areas.
hours_of_operation: n/a

name: Ford Field Park
description: Ford Field Park offers scenic views and access to the Rouge River Gateway Trail.
hours_of_operation: n/a

name: Crowley Park
description: Community park with basketball courts, soccer fields, and picnic areas.
hours_of_operation: n/a

name: Ford Woods Park
description: Park with outdoor play equipment, ball fields, and walking tracks.

name: Hemlock Raymond Park
description: Hemlock Raymond Park features a splash pad, sledding hill, basketball and soccer fields, and handicap-accessible amenities, offering something for all age groups.

name: Lapeer Park
description: Lapeer Park is equipped with handicap-accessible features, an outdoor pool, sand volleyball courts, and various sports fields, catering to recreational and competitive needs.

name: Levagood Park
description: Levagood Park boasts unique features like a natural ice rink, sand volleyball courts, and various other recreational amenities, making it ideal for year-round activities.

name: The Civic Center Park & Fields
description: The Civic Center Park & Fields combines fitness and leisure with handicap-accessible facilities, pickleball courts, and fitness stations for a well-rounded outdoor experience.

name: SMART Bus
description: The Suburban Mobility Authority for Regional Transportation (SMART) operates regional bus services throughout Southeast Michigan, including Dearborn. SMART offers the FAST (Frequent Affordable Safe Transit) bus lines along Michigan Avenue with six stops in Dearborn.
hours_of_operation: Buses run every 30 minutes from 5 AM to midnight

name: UM-Dearborn Shuttle
description: The University of Michigan-Dearborn provides a free shuttle service for students, staff, and faculty. The shuttle connects campus with nearby residential areas and shopping locations.
hours_of_operation: on website

name: Westborn Market
description: Westborn Market is a highly-rated grocery store in Dearborn that emphasizes sustainability and local produce
hours_of_operation: Monday-Saturday: 8 AM - 9 PM; Sunday: 8 AM - 7 PM
